intro: Ceropegia ananthapuramense, commonly known as the Ananthapuram moonvine, is a flowering plant native to India. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within the Ceropegia genus.
